Week of February 9, 2015 <http://www.pivotal.io/platform-as-a-service/cloud-platform-roadshow> THE CLOUD PLATFORM ROADSHOW CONTINUES IN 2015 The Pivotal Cloud Platform Roadshow <http://www.pivotal.io/platform-as-a-service/cloud-platform-roadshow> continues in 2015. Upcoming roadshows include Austin, Houston, Hong Kong, Cincinnati, Raleigh-Durham, Columbus, and Charlotte. Register now <http://www.pivotal.io/platform-as-a-service/cloud-platform-roadshow> in your city.
At this workshop, you’ll get hands-on experience as you test drive Pivotal’s CF platform. In just a few hours, you’ll realize the speed and ease of pushing an application on Pivotal CF, the world's leading enterprise PaaS, powered by Cloud Foundry.
The day is set up to fit your needs and time availability. Come for the first half and learn how Pivotal CF can help you build transformative software. Stay for the second half and learn about the power of Continuous Delivery and Microservices. REGISTER <http://www.pivotal.io/platform-as-a-service/cloud-platform-roadshow> A NEW APPROACH TO BIG DATA Please join us online for this exclusive event as we unveil a groundbreaking new approach and offering that will remove traditional barriers to data-driven innovation.
This event will take place online from 11:00am to 12:30pm (PST). Register today <http://www.pivotal.io/new-approach-to-big-data>. REGISTER <http://www.pivotal.io/new-approach-to-big-data> EPISODE #15: WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 11, "WHAT IS PIVOTAL WEB SERVICES?" <http://pivotal.io/podcasts> Join us this week, Wednesday, February 11th for Episode #15 of our All Things Pivotal Podcast Series, "What is Pivotal Web Services?"
Simon talks about PWS, a service available at run.pivotal.io <run.pivotal.io>. It is a hosted version of Pivotal Cloud Foundry, running on AWS. SUBSCRIBE <http://www.pivotal.io/podcasts> MYSQL SERVICE NOW HIGHLY AVAILABLE ON PIVOTAL CLOUD FOUNDRY <http://blog.pivotal.io/cloud-foundry-pivotal/products/mysql-service-on-pivotal-cloud-foundry-now-highly-available> The Pivotal Cloud Foundry team is excited to announce that the Pivotal Services catalog now includes a highly available MySQL database. Applications that are running on Pivotal Cloud Foundry can now be backed by a resilient relational database. This integrated Database as a Service (DBaaS) ensures continuous availability of critical applications, without requiring the operational overhead of creating and managing a MySQL cluster.
